class code_quality_analyzer.architectural_smell_detector.ArchitecturalSmellDetector(thresholds)[source]

Bases: object

A class to detect architectural smells in Python projects.

This class analyzes Python source code files within a directory to identify various architectural smells based on predefined thresholds.

architectural_smells

A list to store detected architectural smells.

Type:

list

module_dependencies

A directed graph to represent module dependencies.

Type:

nx.DiGraph

module_functions

A dictionary to store functions for each module.

Type:

defaultdict

api_usage

A dictionary to store API usage for each module.

Type:

defaultdict

thresholds

A dictionary of threshold values for various smell detections.

Type:

dict

file_paths

A dictionary to store file paths for each module.

Type:

dict

external_dependencies

A dictionary to store external dependencies for each module.

Type:

dict

function_calls

A dictionary to track inter-module function calls.

Type:

defaultdict

Initialize the ArchitecturalSmellDetector with given thresholds.

Parameters:

thresholds (dict) – A dictionary of threshold values for various smell detections.

__init__(thresholds)[source]

Initialize the ArchitecturalSmellDetector with given thresholds.

Parameters:

thresholds (dict) – A dictionary of threshold values for various smell detections.

load_thresholds(config_path)[source]

Load threshold values from a YAML configuration file.

Parameters:

config_path (str) – Path to the YAML configuration file.

Returns:

A dictionary of threshold values for architectural smells.

Return type:

dict

detect_smells(directory_path)[source]

Detect architectural smells in the given directory.

analyze_directory(directory_path)[source]

Analyze all Python files in the given directory and its subdirectories.

Parameters:

directory_path (str) – The path to the directory to be analyzed.

analyze_file(file_path)[source]

Analyze a single Python file for architectural information with improved intra-project dependency detection.

resolve_external_dependencies()[source]

Resolve external dependencies while preserving intra-project dependencies.

add_smell(name, description, file_path, module_class, line_number=None, severity='medium')[source]

Add a detected architectural smell to the list.

Parameters:

  • name (str) – The name of the smell

  • description (str) – Description of the smell

  • file_path (str) – Path to the file containing the smell

  • module_class (str) – The module or class containing the smell

  • line_number (int, optional) – The line number where the smell was detected

  • severity (str, optional) – The severity level of the smell (default: ‘medium’)

detect_hub_like_dependency()[source]

Detect hub-like dependencies in the project with improved accuracy.

detect_scattered_functionality()[source]

Detect scattered functionality in the project.

detect_redundant_abstractions()[source]

Detect potential redundant abstractions in the project.

detect_god_objects()[source]

Detect god objects in the project.

detect_improper_api_usage()[source]

Detect potential improper API usage in the project.

detect_orphan_modules()[source]

Detect orphan modules in the project.

detect_cyclic_dependencies()[source]

Detect cyclic dependencies with improved accuracy and cycle classification.

detect_unstable_dependencies()[source]

Detect unstable dependencies in the project.

print_report()[source]

Print a report of all detected architectural smells.

If no smells are detected, it prints a message indicating so.

code_quality_analyzer.architectural_smell_detector.analyze_architecture(directory_path, config_path)[source]

Analyze the architecture of a Python project and detect architectural smells.

Parameters:

  • directory_path (str) – The path to the directory containing the Python project to analyze.

  • config_path (str) – The path to the configuration file containing smell detection thresholds.
